dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loudspeaker playing Percy Sledge's "When a Man Loves a Woman," as we see a carnival in the distance - with a Fer Wheel turning round and round. A black man is by a stall. On his arm is an Irish girl wi blond hair. The black man is drunk, and is tossing rings around a bowling pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's cricket, hon. An attendant hands him the teddy bear. It looks ridiculou his huge hands. He gives it to the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter if you don't. He puts his arm around her and drags her on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody won't be offended. Jody's never offended. What'd you say your name was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude. Suits you, Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teddy bear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, fuck the bear. The name. Jude. And it's June. Jude in June. He comes to a small canvas tent with a sign on it - TOILE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta piss, Jude. He holds her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't run off, Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me, do you? Jody walks inside the canvas flap and vanishes from sight can still see his hand, holding Jude's. She leans against canvas, looking bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inside) What if I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd know I wouldn't run off. She stands there, listening to the sound of him urinate. eyes flick around the carnival. They settle on a tall dar haired man in a dark jacket. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never pissed holding a girl's hand, Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Jody He staggers out, buttoning up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice. He goes to kiss her. She turns her head away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him over toward the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never know nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People. They could be looking. Jody follows her, as she walks backward, drawing him on. moves his hips to a song as Jude leads him over the beach under a train trestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get me, soldier --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Jude... He sinks down on his knees toward her. She wraps her arms around his neck and kisses him. Jody writhes on top of he fumbling with his belt. Jude cocks one eye upward. A shad falls across them. CLOSE ON JODY, kissing her. A gun is put to his head. He turns around, drunkenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck -- The gun whacks him across the cheek and he falls sideways Jude scrambles to her feet and darts like an animal throu field. Jody feels his cheek. He can see her blond head vanishing among the fields. He looks up and sees a group of men aro him. The tallest of them, Fergus, cocks the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mini, driving down a country road. Two men in the front three in the back. On the floor of the car Jody lies, with three pairs of fe on top of him, a black bag over his head and the barrel o gun dangling close to his face. Fergus holds the gun. He smoking a cigarette. His movements are slow and somewhat innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your name, soldier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. EXT. SMALL FARMHOUSE - EVENING. INT. FARMHOUSE - NIGHT. Jody pulled through and tied to a chair. Maguire, a small lean man, talks to him through the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation is simple. You're being held hostage by the Irish Republican Army. They've got one of our senior members under interrogation in Castleraigh. We've informed them that if they don't release him within three days, you'll be shot. You'll be treated as our guest until further developments. Have you anything to say? Jody is motionless under the black hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want a cup of tea? He still says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the men are drinking tea. The blond woman comes in wi plate and some food on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See does he want some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want some food? Jody sits as still as a grave, saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late at night -- it is dark. The men are sleeping. Fergus sitting by a chair, gun in his hand, watching the prisone Jude comes in, with a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- what's he like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horny bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you give him it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are certain things I wouldn't do for my country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poke him or something. See if he's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't moved for twelve hours. Go on. Have a heart. She moves over to him. She prods him in the legs with her foot. He doesn't move. Then she lifts the hood ever so slightly, to peer inside. Suddenly the man moves like lightning, jerking his head down so the hood comes off, throwing his body, tied to the chair, over Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking bitch -- you fucking whore -- He pins her to the ground, his body bent with the chair. writhes on top of her in a grotesque parody of love. She screaming and the room is alive, each man awake, grabbing guns, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn the fucking thing off -- EXT. FARMHOUSE - NIGHT. Fergus follows Jude out a back door, holding her by the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking animal. She takes in huge gobs of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking do. I had him all over me. He touches her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough work, that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's got to do it. She rubs her hand on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it was a breeze. Just thought of you. She sidles closer, coming on to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what, Fergus? One of you made me want it... She puts her lips to his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one? She doesn't answer. They embrace. EXT. FARMHOUSE - MORNING. A hot summer's day. There are tall hedges all around the house. Fergus leads Jody, still bound and hooded, over to a greenhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty tomato plants and vines everywhere. Broken glass. T sun pouring through. Fergus leads Jody over to a wrought chair and sits him in it. He sits opposite, gun on his la Fergus takes some sandwiches out of a brown paper bag. He holds one out toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat something, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't eat through a canvas bag. Fergus walks over to him, lifts the hood up so his mouth revealed, and pushes the sandwich toward his lips. Jody e slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a farce, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it a farce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen your fucking face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do I look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one about five ten with the killer smile and the baby face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And the brown eyes. Fergus pushes the last crumbs of the sandwich toward Jody mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the handsome one. Jody eats the last bits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude makes her way from the door toward the greenhouse. S is carrying a pot of tea and two cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is sweltering now in the greenhouse. CLOSE ON JODY'S COWLED HEAD. The hood is drenched with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't fucking breathe, man. Be a Christian, will you? Jude comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to take the hood off, honey... Jude says nothing. Lays the tea on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know it was her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can smell her perfume. Jude pours out the tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, if we took the hood off, we'd have to shoot you. As it is, you've got a fifty-fifty chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you liked me, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fun while it lasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice lady. His breathing becomes labored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, man, I'm suffocating in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we take it off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to check with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus gives her the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look after him. Jody's head follows Fergus while he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me with her, man. She's dangerous... Jude smiles, holding the gun on her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus enters. Maguire and the others. Maguire has a newspaper, which has a headline regarding the kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made the front page. They'll move now, the fuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request permission to take the hood off, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poor whore's suffocating in the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And anyway, he's seen our faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He described me down to a T. Knows what Jude looks like. Maguire reads the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're his keeper. If you don't mind him seeing you, I don't mind. But you're the only one he looks at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude, drinking tea, looking at Jody sweating. Fergus ente He puts his arm casually around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us, Judie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure. She goes. Fergus walks to Jody and slowly takes the hood Jody looks up at him, his face bathed in sweat. He breath in mighty gulps of air. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, soldier. Fergus smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never thought fresh air would taste this good. Fergus pours out a cup of tea and brings it to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if you took the ropes off, I'd be able to feed myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only joking. Fergus drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I was wrong about one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five ten. Brown eyes. But you're no pinup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Not handsome at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trying to hurt my feelings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I could say the same about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I won't. We're more polite around these parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've noticed. Fergus looks at him. Jody isn't smiling anymore. Fergus g back to his seat and drinks his tea. He fingers the gun o his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to do it, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: What makes you think that?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: They're going to let that guy die. And you're going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: They won't let him die.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: You want to bet?

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: I'm not a gambling man.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: And even if he doesn't die -- you can't just let me loose.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Why can't we?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: Not in your nature.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: What do you know about my nature?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: I'm talking about your people, not you.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you know about my people?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: Only that you're all tough undeluded motherfuckers. And that it's not in your nature to let me go.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, would you?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: And you know the funny thing?

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: No, what's the funny thing?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: I didn't even fancy her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't look like that to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not my type. He looks at Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, c'mere. I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My inside pocket. Fergus holds the gun to his face. He fishes inside Jody's inside pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take out the wallet. Fergus's hand emerges with a wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it. CLOSE ON THE WALLET. Credit cards, army identification photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside. There's a picture. Fergus takes out a picture. It is of Jody, in cricket whi smiling, holding a bat. Fergus smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not that one. There's another. Fergus takes out another picture of Jody and of a beautif black woman, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's my type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd be anyone's type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think of it, fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's mine. Anyway, she wouldn't suit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you could say that. Jody chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make a nice couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what were you fucking around for, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckers set me up. That bitch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a friend of mine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. That nice lady. Meets me in a bar. I'm saying what the fuck am I doing here anyway. She buys me a drink. She holds my hand. I'm looking at her saying I don't like you, bitch. But what the fuck. Maybe I'll get to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: What the fuck am I doing here.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: What the fuck were you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: I got sent.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: You could have said no.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: Can't. Once I signed up.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Why did you sign up?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: It was a job. So I get sent to the only place in the world they call you nigger to your face.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Shouldn't take it personally.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: (He imitates a Belfast accent) "Go back to your banana tree, nigger." No use telling them I came from Tottenham.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: And you play cricket?.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: Best game in the world.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Ever see hurling?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: That game where a bunch of paddies whack sticks at each other?

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Best game in the world.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: The fastest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in Antigua cricket's the black man's game. The kids play it from the age of two. My daddy had me throwing googlies from the age of five. Then we moved to Tottenham and it was something different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toffs' game there. But not at home.     . Fergus looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when you come to shoot me, Paddy, remember, you're getting rid of a shit- hot bowler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bear that in mind. He keeps looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, it's not Paddy. It's Fergus. Jody smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure, Jody EXT. GREENHOUSE - NIGHT. Fergus leads Jody outside, holding the gun against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, now. Just go slow. Down by that tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree. He walks toward it, breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to loosen my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, you're going to have to take my dick out for me, aren t you? Fergus, in the dark, stands motionless, looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man, I'm going to wet my pants! Fergus turns him around and unzips his fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the fucker out, man, I'm dying -- Fergus takes Jody's penis out. Jody takes two steps toward the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta lean forward or I'll dribble all over myself. Will you hold my hands for me. Fergus holds his hands from behind, so Jody can lean forw Jody now pisses with immense relief

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, that was worth waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things take time, Fergus. He shakes his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing how these small details take on such importance... He steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now put it back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it! It's only a piece of meat. For fuck's sake, it's got no major diseases. Fergus puts Jody's penis back in his pants and zips him u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I had a case of the clap two years ago. Crabs in Ulster. But all in all it's served me well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Didn't mean to offend you, Fergus. Fergus leads him hack toward the greenhouse. INT. GREENHOUSE - NIGHT. Fergus leads Jody back to his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I know that wasn't easy for you. He begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pleasure was all mine. Fergus begins to laugh, without knowing why. EXT. FARMHOUSE - NIGHT. Maguire, walking out of the house, woken by the sound of laughter. INT. GREENHOUSE - NIGHT. Jody, still laughing. Suddenly the hood is slammed back o his head. Maguire, standing there in the dark, looking at Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. He's just got a sense of humor, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on duty. Keep your fucking mouth shut. Go in and get some sleep. Fergus gets up slowly, walks toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Get some sleep. EXT. FARMHOUSE - NIGHT. Fergus, walking toward the house. He looks back and sees figures of Maguire and Jody in the dark, in absolute sile INT. FARMHOUSE - NIGHT. Fergus sleeping. INT. GREENHOUSE - NIGHT. Jody sleeping. Maguire sitting with an Armalite in his ha watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun coming up over the low hills around the farmhouse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus enters, with a tray and some breakfast. Maguire is sitting where he sat before, stock-still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he talk? Maguire shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't make you laugh? Maguire shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Have some breakfast. He hands Maguire a plate. Jody stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Fergus? Maguire looks hard at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he knows your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all there? He rises, and drags Fergus out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in a minute, Jody

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have minimal contact with the prisoner, do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because tomorrow we might have to shoot him, that's why. Maguire goes back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody sitting with the hood on again. Fergus enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They giving you trouble, Fergus? Fergus says nothing. He takes a plate and brings it towar Jody

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens. Y'see, there's two kinds of people. Those who give and those who take. Fergus lifts up Jody's hood to expose his mouth and begin feed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, take the thing off, man. Fergus says nothing and keeps feeding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I understand. Don't mind if I prattle on, do you? Fergus shakes his head and says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take it by your silence that you don't. He eats. Fergus feeds himself, then feeds more to Jody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two types, Fergus. The scorpion and the frog. Ever heard of them? Fergus says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scorpion wants to cross a river, but he can't swim. Goes to the frog, who can, and asks for a ride. Frog says, "If I give you a ride on my back, you'll go and sting me." Scorpion replies, "It would not be in my interest to sting you since as I'll be on your back we both would drown." Frog thinks about this logic for a while and accepts the deal. Takes the scorpion on his back. Braves the waters. Halfway over feels a burning spear in his side and realizes the scorpion has stung him after all. And as they both sink beneath the waves the frog cries out, "Why did you sting me, Mr. Scorpion, for now we both will drown?" Scorpion replies, "I can't help it, it's in my nature." Jody chuckles under his hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means what it says. The scorpion does what is in his nature. Take off the hood, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you're kind. It's in your nature. Fergus walks toward him and pulls off the hood. Jody smil up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I was right about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody's always right. INT. GREENHOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON. Both men dozing in the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would you most like to be now, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man. If this shit was all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a pint in the Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lack imagination, Fergus. Think of something more alluring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like having a pint in the Metro -- Fergus laughs.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Having two pints in the Rock.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: Having a pint in the Metro, and Dil's having a margarita.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Who's Dil?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: My special friend.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: We got simple tastes, you and me.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: The best.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: But you fellas never get a break, do you?

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. We do a tour of duty and we're finished. But you guys are never finished, are you?

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: We don't look on it like that.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: I've often wondered how you do it.

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Depends on what you believe in.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: What do you believe in?

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: That you guys shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: JODY
dialogues.text: It's as simple as that?

dialogues.speaker: FERGUS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that thing back on him, Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter if he's hot. Just cover the fucker up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you no feelings, woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut your face -- She pulls the hood down over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're heading for trouble, Fergus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good soldier, Jude. She whacks him with a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said shut the fuck up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He believes in the future -- INT. GREENHOUSE - NIGHT. Jody, sitting in the hood. Fergus lifts it a bit; Jody's mouth, with blood now in his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not bad. Women are trouble, you know that, Fergus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kinds of women are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil wasn't trouble. No trouble at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You liked her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present tense, please. Love her. Whatever she is. I'm thinking of her now, Fergus. Will you think of her too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want you to do something, Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they kill me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they will. As sure as night follows day. They have to. I want you to find her out. Tell her I was thinking of her. Fergus is moved. He can't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if she's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her picture. C'mere. Fergus walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. In the inside pocket. Their faces, close to each other as Fergus searches out h picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the whole lot. I won't need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to talk that way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Millie's Hair Salon in Spitalfields. Take her to the Metro for a margarita. Don't have to tell her who you are. Just tell her Jody was thinking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it -- The door opens. Maguire is there, with another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volunteer? Fergus turns toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you inside. Fergus walks toward Maguire and the other man walks forwa takes his seat. Fergus, unseen by Maguire, puts the walle his pocket. INT. FARMHOUSE - NIGHT. Maguire, Jude, Fergus, and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had word. They've used every trick in the book on him. He's starting to talk. You're going to have to do it in the morning. Maguire lights a cigarette. Fergus looks at him and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a volunteer, am n't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I was beginning to have my doubts about you for the last few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the only one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Jude. You best get some sleep tonight, Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request permission to guard the prisoner tonight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. Don't let him, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, Jude. He turns back to Fergus. He puts his arm on Fergus's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would make me feel better about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You're a good man, Fergus. Fergus leaves. INT. GREENHOUSE - NIGHT. Fergus takes his place in the chair beside Jody. Jody begins to laugh under the hood. It turns into the so of crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crying stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just help me. Give me a cigarette. Fergus takes out a cigarette, lights it, and lifts up Jod hood so he can smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even smoke, you know that? It just seemed the right thing to do. Fergus watches him puff the cigarette, the hood just abov his lips. Jody coughs, but keeps the cigarette in his lip Fergus gently takes the cigarette from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to sleep. Tell me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the one about the frog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the scorpion. No. Tell me anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought as a child. But when I became a man I put away childish things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something, anything. Fergus is silent; his eyes wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a lot of use, are you, Fergus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No, I'm not good for much... EXT. FIELDS - MORNING. The farmhouse covered in mist. The sun coming through it. EXT. GREENHOUSE - MORNING. Maguire opens the door to the greenhouse and clicks the chamber of his gun. Fergus has a gun in his hand. He chec the chamber. Fergus takes Jody, whose hands are still tied behind his back, by the elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand up, now -- Jody rises. Fergus leads him through the door, past Magui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to say on behalf of the Irish Republican Army -- Fergus turns with sudden fierceness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him be -- He pulls Jody through the fields. EXT. TREES - MORNING. Fergus pushing Jody through a copse of trees, the gun at back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the hood off, Fergus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see a bit. Please, please. Don't make me die like an animal. Fergus pulls the hood off. Jody looks around him. He has cut lip where Jude struck him. Fergus prods him on with the gun. Jody stumbles forward. Fergus is all cold and businesslike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're doing it, do you know that, Fergus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause you're my friend. And I want you to go to the Metro --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that talk now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurling's a fast game, isn't it, Fergus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fastest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster than cricket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cricket's in the halfpenny place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if I ran now, there's no way I'd beat you, is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I did... you wouldn't shoot a brother in the back -- Jody suddenly sprints, and, loosening the ties on his han then freeing them, he is off like a hare. Fergus screams fury after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus aims, then changes his mind and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid bastard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you say, faster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you bastard -- stop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to catch me first -- Fergus gains on him -- stretches his arm out -- but Jody sprints ahead again -- as if he has been playing with him laughs in exhilaration. Fergus pants behind him, wheezing almost laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to run the mile, you know -- four times round the cricket pitch -- what was that game called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurling -- Jody runs, whipping through the trees -- always ahead of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Fergie -- you can do it -- a bit more wind -- Fergus grabs his shoulder and Jody shrugs it off, gaining him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bit of fun, Fergus, eh? And suddenly the trees give way. Jody turns, laughing, to Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you I was fast -- Fergus is panting, pointing the gun at Jody

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it. And suddenly a Saracen tank whips around the corner, hits Jody with the full of its fender. His body flies in the a and bounces forward as another tank tries to grind to a h and the huge wheels grind over him. Fergus, screaming, "No-!" He almost moves forward, then s soldiers spilling from the tank around the body. Fergus t and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus whipping through the trees, his body crouched low he runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tinker sitting in the greenhouse. A helicopter screams in view through the panes and automatic fire comes from it, shattering every pane in seconds and tearing Tinker to bi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets whipping through every window, taking chunks from masonry, tearing the walls apart. Maguire, Jude, and the others on the floor, scrambling for weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus, hearing the gunfire, runs through overhanging branches till eventually he is hidden from sight. EXT. CARNIVAL ON THE MONAGHAN BORDER - DAWN. A forlorn-looking building over nondescript fields. An old man wheels a bicycle slowly toward it; a rusty car appears; and Fergus gets out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back in the pink, Tommy? How're you keeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man pouring whiskey into a teacup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll notice I've asked you nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wise, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then. I like to be wise. He pours Fergus more whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you need, Fergus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need to go across the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need to lose myself awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha. He looks at Fergus and lights a cigarette. He puffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a man I know ships cattle to London. EXT. DUBLIN BAY - EVENING. The ferry, churning into the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP into an elegant, empty Georgian room, covered in clouds of dust. A figure among the clouds of dust, hackin a wall with a sledgehammer. It is Fergus, dressed in laborer's overalls, covered in dust. He is knocking the bricks from an outer wall. He works furiously and relentlessly, like a machine. We see the wall, with the hammer striking it. One brick f away, then another. Daylight pours through the clouds of and the growing hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus's face, as he works. The hole. More bricks falling away. Through the clouds of dust and the streams of daylight we now see a patch of gr Fergus's face, working. His rhythm slows. The hole. More bricks fall away. Then the hammer stops. T dust begins to clear. His face. The jagged hole. The dust drifts across it, revealing a cricket pitch, with tiny sticklike figures running on the green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus, returning from work, crosses the street, and ente through a white door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus dressing. He puts on a cheap suit, like any countr boy in a big city. He takes Jody's wallet from the trouse of his overalls. He flips it open, sees the picture of th soldier and Dil. He puts it in the pocket of his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus walking down a street looking for an address. Some distance down the street is a sign -- MILLIE'S UNISEX HAI SALON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus, standing as the crowds go by him, looking in the window. He has the picture in his hand. We see Dil from h point of view, then Fergus walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus enters. The door gives a loud ping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closing. I'll see you tomorrow, Dil She leaves the salon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want something in particular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a bit of a trim... Dil checks her watch and stubs out a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... She gestures toward a chair. Fergus sits down. She comes toward him and fiddles with his hair. She pushes his head back into a basin behind him. She beg to knead his hair in hot water and shampoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone recommend you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy I work with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? Fergus can't think of an answer. The hands with the purpl nails run over his scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't the water get to your nails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Fergus, sitting up. She begins to cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The accent, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's it like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like treacle. She imitates his accent saying it. Fergus laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice laugh. Dil raises Fergus's head up, with his new-cut hair and ho a mirror up behind his head so he can see the back. He lo like a young London stockbroker. The hair salon around th is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should make her happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. Who is she? EXT. HAIR SALON - EVENING. Fergus emerges from the shop. He takes one last look thro the window where Dil is taking off her smock, touching up hair, etc. It is as if she has forgotten all about him. H walks off through the crowds and then ducks into a doorwa The doorway of the shop. Dil comes out, dressed in a pair high heels, a very short skirt, different, more raunchy clothes on her than we saw inside. She locks the glass do and walks down the street, across the road, and into a pu called the Metro. Fergus follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half full, with an after-work crowd. Dil makes her way through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, hon. She sits down at the bar. Fergus comes toward the bar and takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bottle of Guinness. Dil, looking at Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that, Col?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what, Dil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave me a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he? Fergus blushes. He buries himself in his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just cut his hair, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Fergus throws his eyes toward her again. She has her face turned away, but sees him in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, he did it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, that was a look. She eyes Fergus in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him to ask me what I'm drinking. The barman, with infinite weariness, approaches Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to know do you want to know what she's drinking. Fergus is about to talk when she pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A margarita. The barman mixes it. She stares at the mirror, staring at Fergus, who is trying to avoid her eyes. The barman hands the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he can look.... Ask him does he like his hair, Col.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to know, sir, do you like your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I'm very happy with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Scottish, Col.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say, Col?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He agreed that he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think his name is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've no thoughts on the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said. Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, Dil A burly man sits down beside her. He puts his hand on her knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing the song, Dil -- She slaps the hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, babe! You know what I like... Easy! She turns back to Fergus and finds his seat empty. EXT. METRO - NIGHT. Fergus, standing across the road from the pub. He is sweating. Dil comes out of the pub. She looks this way an that, as if searching for Fergus. Fergus stands back into shadow. Dave, the burly man, comes out. He grabs her by the elbow She shrugs him off. She walks off. Dave follows, grabs he the elbow again. The sense of an old argument. Dave sudde strikes her across the face with his open palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans her head against a wall. Dave then puts his arm around her, consoles her. EXT. STREET - NIGHT. Dave walking, holding Dil by the arm. The street is dilapidated, full of squats. They stop outside a door. Di opens the door with a key from her purse and they both wa inside. Fergus stands there, observing. A light comes on in an upstairs room. Dil enters; we see shadow in silhouette behind the curtain and the shadow of Dave coming in behind her. He begins to remove her blouse She stands absolutely still as he does so. Fergus backs away, then walks off. INT. HOSTEL - NIGHT. Fergus, in bed. Fade to black as we see Jody as a bowler, running in slow motion, toward the camera. He releases th ball; we see Fergus in bed, breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus takes a break and watches the batsman hit a ball. imitates the batsman's motion with his sledgehammer. Then voice interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Pat's a cricket fan, eh? Fergus turns. We see Tristram Deveroux, a young Sloane ty in a three-piece suit, whose house it is. Beside him is Franknum, the cockney foreman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Pat. It's Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Pat, Mick, what the fuck. Long as you remember you're not at Lords. Fergus resumes work. INT. METRO - NIGHT. It is now crowded with people, black, white, punky and st chic, a lot of leather All the women are heavily made-up. Someone is singing from the tiny stage and rows of cheap colored bulbs are flashing around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the way Fergus walks through, it is obvious he has n been here at night. He seems most out of place in his che suit, making his way through the crowd to the bar. AT THE BAR. Fergus looks through the odd crowd, but can't find Dil. C the barman, sees him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can we consider you a regular, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that good or bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you get to say, The usual, Col. Things like that. Col pushes a colored cocktail with one of those Japanese umbrellas toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's call this the usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Fergus reaches for his wallet to pay, but Col interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. It's on me. Fergus tries to pretend he's familiar with the drink, and implication, whatever are the norms of the place. He lift the glass to his mouth, but the umbrella keeps getting in way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it out, if you want. Fergus takes out the umbrella. He holds it in one hand an drinks with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came to see her, didn't you? Fergus shrugs. He takes out a cigarette. A guy in leather his left smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I should tell you. She's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's what? The barman looks up toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on. THE JUKEBOX. A hand presses a button. The needle selects a disk. A son Dave Berry, "The Crying Game." AT THE BAR. Fergus looks up. Close-up of Dil's hand, as music begins, making movements to the music. We see Dil, standing on a stage, swaying slightly. She seems a little drunk. She mi to the song. She mouths the words so perfectly and the vo on the song is so feminine that there is no way of knowin who is doing the singing. She does all sorts of strange movements, as if she is drawing moonbeams with her hands. The crowd seems to know this act. They cheer, whether out approval or derision we can't be sure. Fergus watching. Dil singing, noticing him. She comes to the end of the so The crowd cheers. Fergus, watching her make her way through the crowded bar toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still looking, Col.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Persistent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing in a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excellent quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he wants something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would expect he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him yourself. She looks at Fergus directly, sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me. Fergus says nothing. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody wants something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you. How quaint. How old-fashioned and quaint. Isn't it, Col? Col shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You old-fashioned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be. The burly man comes up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got the money, Dil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking did. He suddenly jerks her roughly off the stool, spilling her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you? Well, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags her through the crowd. In the mirror, Fergus wat them go. The barman eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes all types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's what she should run a mile from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why doesn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows the secrets of the human heart. Fergus suddenly stands and makes his way to the door. EXT. PUB - NIGHT. Fergus comes out. A black bouncer is there, but there is sign of Dil. He walks a few yards and hears voices down a alley. He looks up it. P0V - ALLEY. We see Dil pushing Dave away. He grabs her, turns her roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be like that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me -- She beats his arms away. Money falls on the ground. She staggers away from him. He picks up the money, then runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got very fucking grand, haven't we -- He tries to pull her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me, you stupid bitch -- They both bump into Fergus, who just stands there and doe move an inch. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. You forgot your bag. He holds it up to show her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Dave eyes Fergus. Fergus grabs his wrists and upends him the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, they get the wrong idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the ground) Cunt. Fergus puts his foot on Dave's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all get the wrong idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cunt. Scrag-eyed dyke cunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming. Dave grabs for her ankle. She kicks his hand away. Fergus presses down his foot. He looks to Dil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break his neck. Fergus presses his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't. She bends low to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to take his foot off slowly, David. Then you're to go home, like a good boy. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cunt. But his voice is softer. Fergus removes his foot. Dil gra his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, honey. She draws him away. EXT. METRO - NIGHT. They walk out of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants me to perform for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perform?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You on the game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God no. I'm a hairdresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus looks back. Dave is rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave me then, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus and Dil climb slowly upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to ask you in, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not cheap, you know that? Loud, but never cheap. There is a movement lower down the staircase. We see Dave holding his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking dumb dyke carrot cunt. Dil leans close to Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you kissed me, it would really get his goat. She tilts up her face. Fergus kisses her, tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if you asked me to meet you tomorrow, it would really drive him insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-five. At Millie's. She goes in and closes the door. Fergus stands and looks at Dave, who turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil walks out of the salon, smiling, and walks toward Fer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that look again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one you gave me in the Metro. Fergus takes a bunch of flowers from behind his back. She holds them, with theatrical feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, you shouldn't have. She laughs and leans toward him and kisses him in a classically old-fashioned way. The girls inside the salon pull back a curtain, and they all clap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder. She takes his arm and walks off with him. INT. INDIAN RESTAURANT - NIGHT. Fergus and Dil looking at their menus. A waiter places dr on their table, then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's the time you're meant to do something, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a pass or something. Isn't that the way it goes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are walking in an alleyway toward her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a special friend, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want one? And suddenly a car drives very fast toward them, headligh on. Fergus pulls her into a doorway to avoid it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. The car continues down the road, stops, and then screeche off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Dave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things a girl has to put up with. She looks down toward where the car has pulled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm frightened, Jimmy. That's not like him. EXT. DIL'S FLAT. A car pulls up behind Dil and Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off, Dave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough guy, huh? Are you going to be all right on your own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not on my own, am I? She touches his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on up, would you? INT. DIL'S FLAT - NIGHT. Dil comes in in the darkness. Fergus stands like a shadow the doorway. The light comes on; she takes off her rainco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't hurt you to come in. Fergus enters slowly. He looks around the room; there is exaggerated femininity about everything in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiskey. She goes into a small kitchen. Fergus looks at the mantelpiece and sees a picture of Jody. The camera tracks into the soldier's smiling face. Then into Fergus's face. reverie is broken by the sound of a voice outside -- Dave She comes through with two drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus fucking Christ. She opens the window door, and we see Dave on the street, a neck brace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stirling fucking Moss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dave. She goes back into the room and begins taking things up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me, Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Dave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Dil -- She flings things down: men's clothes, leather trousers, suitcase, a teddy bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't throw my clothes out the window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off back to Essex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking mad! Fergus looks to the man down in the street, a parody of rejection with his things in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't chuck my clothes out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your fucking goldfish, too! Dil grabs a large goldfish bowl and flings it down. The b breaks to bits on the pavement. Goldfish thrash around in street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking bitch! He tries to pick up the flapping fish in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murderer! Upstairs, Dil closes the window shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. How'd he drive with his neck in a brace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be in love to manage that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't know the meaning of the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus stands as Dil hands him a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lived here with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried to. Sit down, will you? Fergus walks past the photograph and sits down. He looks her to the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? He nods toward the picture. She looks down into her drink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As different as it's possible to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And they fall into one another's arms. She stretches up w her whole body over him. They grow suddenly and violently passionate. They fall into the cushions of the couch onto the floor. photograph above them seems to smile. He draws up her dre with his hands. She suddenly pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you do that to him? She comes up toward him once more. She puts her mouth clo to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know how I kissed him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you jealous of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good... She opens the buttons on his shirt and her mouth travels his chest. Fergus tries to draw her up toward him, but he hand reaches up to his mouth and presses his head back wh her other hand undoes his pants. She kisses his stomach; mouth moves down his body. Fergus stares at the picture o Jody. Jody's eyes seem to burn through him. Dil raises he head and kisses his mouth. There are tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would he think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't think. He's dead. In Ireland. He was a soldier. Went there like a fool. She sits in front of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you miss him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say that like a gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you're concerned. Fergus gets up and stands behind her, gently pushes the h from her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can t stay, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real gentleman... She embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be in mourning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. She sits back down in front of the mirror. Fergus leaves. reapplies her lipstick. INT. METRO - NIGHT. Singer in a blue dress. Dil and Fergus by the bar. Both drinking drinks with umbrellas. Dave comes up behind them with his neck brace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I won't fucking fuck off. Said I'm sorry, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I heard. You hear, Jimmy? Fergus nods. He stands. Dave steps two feet back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only going to ask her for a dance. Fergus takes Dil's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we? The woman is singing. As they circle, people begin to look at them admiringly. holds her cheek close to his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he come here too? DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this an obsession of yours? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did sometimes. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he dance with you? Dil doesn't answer. Looks at him out of the corner of her eye. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want with me, Jimmy? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to look after you. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I heard someone say once. She draws back and looks at him. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She dances closer. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I told you, you wouldn't believe me. In the bar, people singing along with the music. Col sing Dave sitting at the bar, sulking. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not having me on, are you? 'Cause Dil can't stand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She puts her cheek against his. Dave, at the bar, slams h drink down. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she does get very upset... Dave stands up to leave. On the stage the act finishes. D draws Fergus back to the bar. AT THE BAR. Col, the barman, pours her drink. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One for him, too. Col pours and smiles. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm superstitious. Drink. He drinks. He grimaces. She throws it back in one. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't leave me now. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is, can you go the distance? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends what it is. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, depends on nothing. She takes the bottle herself and fills their glasses. She slams it back. He sips. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tilts his glass back. He swallows it in one. INT. DIL'S FLAT - NIGHT. She enters; Fergus walks in slowly. He looks from the cri whites that are hanging up behind a curtain to the photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you thinking of, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking of your man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm wondering why you keep his things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you, I'm superstitious. She turns toward him and undoes her hair. It falls around shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he ever tell you you were beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time. Fergus runs his hand down her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks after me. He's a gentleman too. She draws him behind a curtain toward the bed, pulls him down. They kiss passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me one minute. She walks into the bathroom. Fergus lies there, looking a the picture, listening to the sound of running water. She comes out then, dressed in a silk kimono. She looks extraordinarily beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out his hand and grasps hers. He draws her tow him. He begins to kiss her face and neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would he have minded? She murmurs no. His hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders. CLOSE ON HIS HANDS, traveling down her neck, in the darkn Then the hands stop. The kimono falls to the floor gently with a whisper. The camera travels with it, and we see, i close-up, that she is a man. Fergus sits there, frozen, staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did know, didn't you? Fergus says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. She gives a strange little laugh, then reaches out to tou him. Fergus smacks the hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. I feel sick -- He gets up and runs to the bathroom. She grabs his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go, Jimmy -- He kicks her away. He runs into the bathroom and vomits i the tub. She crouches on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I thought you knew. He retches again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing in the bar if you didn't know -- I'm bleeding... She lights a cigarette. Fergus runs the taps. He washes his face, rinses his mout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Jimmy. I can take it. Just not on the face. Fergus slams the door shut. She is sitting on the couch, kimono round her once more, looking very much like a woma trace of blood on her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'see, I'm not a young thing any longer.... Funny the way things go. Don't you find that, Jimmy? Never the way you expected. Fergus comes out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. She looks up. Some hope in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that? And he makes to go. She grabs him to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go like that. Say something... He pulls away from her. She falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. He drags himself away and runs down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus in bed. Flash to shot of blackness, Jody grinning cricket whites, throwing the ball up and down in his hand INT. METRO - NIGHT. The place is hopping. Fergus enters. He now sees it as he should have seen it the first night -- as a transvestite He makes his way through the crowds. All the women too- heavily made-up. Some beautifully sleek young things he l at he realizes are young men. He makes his way to the bar where Dil is sitting, nursing a drink with an umbrella in Her face is bruised. She is wearing dark glasses. As he walks toward her she sees him in the mirror. She ta to Col the barman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back, Col

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't want any of those looks, Col. They don't mean much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Tell him to go fuck himself. Fergus sits. Col turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants me to tell you go fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. There is a tear running down her cheek, under the dark glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to stop messing Dil around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him it hurt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to her, Col --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says he's got to talk to you -- Fergus touches her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? She whips her arm away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him again, Col. Go fuck himself -- She walks into the crowd, toward the door. Fergus leaves. EXT. STREET - NIGHT. Fergus, walking outside Dil's place. The blinds in her ro are down and the light is on inside. We see her outline, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette hear the song "The Crying Game." Fergus stands beneath her doorway, scribbles a note, and sticks it in the letter box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard w a pole and replaces it with a number nine. Below the scoreboard we can see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus, fitting a new window into the finished wall. On t pitch we see the cricketers, distorted through the moving glass of the window. Across the pitch Dil walks, with a l basket in her hand, dressed in a very short skirt with hi heels. As she approaches the site a chorus of whistles br out. Fergus, hearing the whistling, stares out. He sees Dil mo toward the site. He drops the window and the glass shatte As the whistles continue, we see Dil in the site's lift, which rises up. We see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up ladder toward Fergus .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did that frame cost, Mr. Franknum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred quid, Mr. Deveroux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Pat just cost me two hundred quid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry won't bring the bloody thing back, will it, Mr. Franknum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in my experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off his wages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to know do I mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you do, Mr. Deveroux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody right I do... Through this conversation Fergus can hear the chorus of w whistles increasing. He looks out the gap where the windo should be and sees Dil in the lift. The laborers whistle her, looking up her skirt, etc. She passes by a gap in the wall and blows a kiss at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that his tart? Does Pat have a tart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a tart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course not, she's a lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not that either. Fergus walks out of the room. Fergus walks round the scaffolding. Dil sees him and wave sits on some bricks and opens the hamper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling -- She is acting bright and businesslike, like any wife. She wearing dark glasses to cover the bruise on her face. She pecks him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never let the sun go down on an argument, Jody used to say. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doing here? DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your note. So let's kiss and make up, hon. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me that. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, darling. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it over, Dil -- DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apologies, my sweet. Fergus smiles in spite of himself. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more like it, dear. Have a cuppa. She takes out a thermos and pours him some tea. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're something else, Dil, you know that? DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never said a truer word. She hands him a neatly cut sandwich. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I was always best looking after someone. Must be something in the genes. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be. DIL
