dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the fact that you didn't know is basically the fault of yours truly. And even when you were throwing up, I could tell you cared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you care, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I care, Dil. She lowers her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crying, Dil? He removes her glasses and looks at her moist eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired and emotional. Then he hears a voice behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it on your own time, Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is she does for you. Fergus looks from Dil to Deveroux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was her I'd consider that an insult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it how you like. Just get that bloody tart out of here. Fergus stands up suddenly. He speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever pick your teeth up with broken fingers? Deveroux stares, suddenly chilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVEROUX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a simple question. Deveroux says nothing. Fergus looks down to Dil. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, dear. He holds out his arm. Dil gathers up her things and takes Her face is wreathed in a smile. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't answer, honey -- Fergus walks her down the scaffolding ramp. FRANKNUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that, Mr. Deveroux. Dil and Fergus descend from the site in the lift. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, oh my, Jimmy, how gallant. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made me feel all funny inside. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said stop it. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me to meet you again, Jimmy. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's wise? DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's wise. The lift stops with a thud. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to hit you. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of liked you as a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it up to me, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask to meet me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you meet me again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever. Tonight. She leans forward and kisses him. Fergus hears a wail of catcalls behind him. He watches Dil go as the lift takes back up to the site. EXT. HAIR SALON - EVENING. Fergus, outside the hair salon. Dil, inside, is throwing her smock and walking toward him. All the girls are smili Fergus looks from Dil to the girls as they approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I didn't know. And don't call me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help it, Jimmy. A girl has her feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing is, Dil, you're not a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Details, baby, details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they do know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, they do. She takes his arm as they walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have known, shouldn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of wish I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can always pretend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true.... Your soldier knew, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't be quite the same though, will it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you pretending yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. Fergus hears a car following them, and turns around to lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Dave. He knew too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I becoming repetitious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. They reach her door. The car stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Can't pretend that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should have stayed a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be cruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Be a good girl and go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you kiss me. Fergus kisses her. He looks at her open lips as if in disbelief at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delirious. She goes inside. INT. HOSTEL - NIGHT. Fergus walks into the room and turns on a small desk-ligh Then he hears a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Jude sitting in the corner. Her hair is now dark brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You vanished. He stares at her, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it, Fergus? Did you blow the gaff on us or did you just fuck up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's the last thing I'll do. You never asked what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Tinker died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maguire and me got out by the skin of our teeth. No thanks to you.... What you think of the hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suits you. She walks round the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, I was sick of being blond. Needed a tougher look, if you know what I mean. She lies down on the bed beside him, takes off a black leather glove, and puts her hand on his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me, Fergus. He takes her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I to take it that's a no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says nothing. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a court-martial in your absence. They wanted to put a bullet in your head. I pleaded for clemency. Said we should find out what happened first. So what did happen? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran. I couldn't shoot him in the back. I tried to catch him. He made it to the road and got hit by a Saracen. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you did fuck up. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know what the thing is, Fergus? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what is the thing? JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You vanished quite effectively. Became Mister Nobody. And you've no idea how useful that could be. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got some plans here. And we'll need a Mister Nobody to execute them. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, Jude. I'm out. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never out, Fergus. She looks at him hard. He looks away. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you don't care whether you die or not. But consider the girl, Fergus. The wee black chick. He leaps up from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her out of this. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Fergus, you're a walking cliche. You know we won't leave her out of this. But I'm glad to see you care. She brings her lips close to his so they touch. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I must admit I'm curious. He grabs her hair and pulls her head back. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you know, Jude? She pulls a gun and sticks it between his teeth. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking tell me, boy -- Fergus stares at her. Then says quietly: FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's nobody. She likes me. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I suppose a fuck is out of the question. Keep your head down, Fergus. No sudden moves. And not a whisper to her. You'll be hearing from us. She kisses him briefly, with the gun at his temple. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the faith. She goes. Fergus stands in the darkness. EXT. HAIR SALON - EVENING. Fergus, walking toward the hair salon, flowers in his han He stands outside watching, the flowers behind his back. the chair turns and we see it is Jude. Fergus freezes. He sees Jude looking at him, smiling brightly, then talking back to Dil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He your boyfriend? Jude, turning in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky you. INT. INDIAN RESTAURANT - NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd bring me carnations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I got it wrong, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. She smiles brightly at something behind Fergus. He turns sees Jude is there. Fergus stands, suddenly. He throws some money on the table, grabs her arm, and fro marches her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, honey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tell me why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pass Jude, she smiles. EXT. INDIAN RESTAURANT - NIGHT. Outside the restaurant. Fergus marches Dil away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Jimmy? Tell me what's wrong

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here. They pass out of shot. In the background we see Jude risi INT. METRO - NIGHT. Dil and Fergus making their way to their seats at the bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tell me what it is? A figure sitting down at the bar. It is Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know her, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, is it? Do you know me, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil, this is Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just checking. He being nice to you, Dil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever so nice. Aren't you, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. I'm glad. Young love, as they say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. The younger the better. Doesn't come your way much, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go looking for it, Dil. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you'll get lucky. Someday. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit heavy on the powder, isn't she, Jimmy? DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl has to have a bit of glamour. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Long as she can keep it. Isn't that right, James... She leaves. Dil watches her go. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her, isn't it? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her? DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the thing you had to tell me. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you know that? I'm really sorry. She looks at Col DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that, Col? COL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw it, Dil. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it, is what I say. COL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fuck it, Dil. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking men, Col --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck 'em. There are tears in her eyes. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And fuck you, Jimmy -- She staggers out of the pub. Fergus sits there. There is expression in Col's eyes that makes Fergus feel very, ver small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could always make it up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a girl runs out like that, she generally wants to be followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a girl, Col --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say. But Fergus rises and walks out. EXT. METRO - NIGHT. A figure standing down the alleyway, smoking. Fergus look toward it, but Jude is standing there, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went that way -- Jude grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you come with me. She draws him down an alley where the same car is waiting They get inside. ANOTHER CAR - BY THE PUB. Dil, sitting inside a taxi watching Fergus and Jude getti in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the moving car. Jude is driving, Maguire next to her. Fergus sits in the back. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it was you all the time. MAGUIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd you think it was? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was Dave. MAGUIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who's Dave when he's at home? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at home. MAGUIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should blow you away, you know that? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. Maguire stubs his cigarette out on Fergus's hand, then wh him on the teeth with his closed fist. MAGUIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting emotional. And I don't want to get fucking emotional -- you understand, Hennessy? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. MAGUIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, too -- Jude drives. Fergus looks through the back window at the street outside. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone, Peter. He's in love. MAGUIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That true, Fergus? You in love? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's she like between the sheets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely unusual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what'll happen if you fuck up again, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, I do, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. EXT. REGENCY SQUARE - NIGHT. The car draws to a halt in a sedate square. Several doors down is the entrance to what looks like a sedate conserva club. In the car, Maguire turns off the engine. He nods toward building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think that is, Hennessy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a knocking-shop. Tres discreet, huh? He visits his ladies on Tuesday and Thursday nights and Saturday mornings. His security's in the car beyond. He nods toward a car, a Daimler, parked some distance awa Fergus looks from the window to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter who he is. He is what we would call a legitimate target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You being cynical, Hennessy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever hits him'll be hit, if those men are any good. And I presume you can't get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of suicide, isn't it? Jude turns around to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, then, I don't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Och, you do, Fergie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Fergie. A rehearsal. Jude and Fergus get out of the car. They walk down the street, down from the brothel-cum-club, where there is a bar with some tables outside. EXT. REGENCY SQUARE - NIGHT. Fergus and Jude, crossing the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep your mind on the job, boy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you'll leave her out of it? JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye. Then we'll leave her be. They take their seats by the tables. We can see the broth down the way. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's arthritic. Takes him two minutes to get to the door. She checks her watch. Fergus is sweating. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if I say no? JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what. Go. Down by the brothel, the door swings open. Fergus walks like any pedestrian down toward the brothel. There is an old, portly gent in a City suit emerging from The car by the pavement kicks into action and the door op Fergus quickens his pace. Jude, by the cafe, watches. Fergus, walking. The gent makes his way, with gout-ridden slowness, across pavement, through the passersby, toward the car. A burly security man emerging from the car, walking towar the old gent. Fergus reaches the car just before he does, and passes between him and the open door. The old gent's stomach bru Fergus's elbow. GENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, young man -- Fergus walks on. Jude, from the cafe, watches -- Fergus walking on, the ol man being eased with painstaking care inside the Daimler. Then the door closing and the Daimler pulling off. When the Daimler has passed Fergus, he turns around and w back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude smiles and leaps up as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were made for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be on the other side. We'll move when you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if you don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus, I think you don't trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay late at your work tomorrow night and I'll bring you the gear. Jude begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the old geezer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some judge... She walks off, crosses the road to Maguire, in the car. Fergus turns around to see Dil in front of the cafe. She inside; he follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you follow me, Dil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was jealous, Jimmy. She downs a drink and motions for another. She seems high FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't be, Dil DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't I be jealous? There are tears streaming down her face. He takes his han and begins to wipe her face. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. My makeup. She sits down; he joins her. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She own you, Jimmy? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She from Scotland too? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say that. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're not going to tell me more? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. He wipes the tears from her face with a tissue then dabs tissue in her drink and wipes some more. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doing, Jimmy? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like me even a little bit? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than that. Dil's face, staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go for a walk. She allows herself to be led out. EXT. HAIR SALON - NIGHT. Dil and Fergus walking. Fergus stops her by the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do something for me, Dil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd do anything for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the keys to the shop? They walk inside. INT. HAIR SALON - NIGHT. Dil and Fergus standing in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want another haircut, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sit down. He sits her down in one of the chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd do anything for me? Dil nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything. Fergus takes up a scissors to snip at her hair. Her head leaps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said anything, Dil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl has to draw the line somewhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to change you to a man, Dil... She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd like me better that way, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you wouldn't leave me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. She takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, then. Fergus begins to cut. CLOSE-UP ON DlL'S FACE as her hair is shorn. Tears stream down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're no good at this, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. But he keeps cutting. He gives Dil a short, cropped milit cut like Jody's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to make me look like him... FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Want to make you into something new. That nobody recognizes... She looks in the mirror at it in the dark. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't recognize myself, Jimmy. INT. DIL'S FLAT - NIGHT. Dil enters, with her new haircut. She goes to turn on the light. He stops her hand. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She looks at her hand on his. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better in the dark. Her fingers close around his. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's true, then? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like me better like this. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She brings her lips to his neck. He lets them stay there. hands travel up to her blouse. He begins to undo the butt DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jimmy -- Slowly the blouse slips down, exposing her male torso. Sh falls down to her knees and tugs at his belt. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. Dil... get up... He raises her to her feet and leads her toward the bed. S stretches languorously down on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unzips her skirt slowly, and draws it off. She turns o the bed sexily, her face to the mattress. She is wearing suspender-belts underneath her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby... But Fergus stands and walks quietly over to the wardrobe where the soldier's things are. Dil on the bed, slowly tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, honey... We see Fergus from her point of view, coming toward her w Jody's white cricket shirt, glowing eerily in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. What you doing? Fergus draws her slowly up to a standing position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try this on, Dil He wraps the shirt around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you... She kisses him. EXT. SMALL HOTEL - NIGHT. Fergus leading Dil, dressed in Jody's cricket clothes, do the street and inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we going here, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look on it like a honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From above, we see the figures of Fergus and Dil, sleepin a double bed, both fully clothed. Fergus smokes, then put out the cigarette. Time lapse. The light gradually fills the room. Fergus wa Looks at the bedside clock, and very gingerly rises, puts his coat, and walks out. EXT. SITE - EVENING. A car pulls up at the site. Jude gets out. She has a satc in her hand. INT. SITE - EVENING. Fergus looking down a ladder-staircase at Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a handyman, Fergie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take pride in my work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sincerely hope so. Fergus climbs down a ladder to Jude; she hands him someth from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tools of the trade. She kisses him. Fergus looks at her expressionlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And forget about the girl. Fergus opens what Jude has given him -- looking inside. T is a gun wrapped in an oilcloth. INT. SMALL HOTEL - NIGHT. Fergus enters. The room is empty. He calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil? No reply. He runs outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus looks up at her building, but the lights are off i her flat. The sound of feet behind him. He turns and sees walking toward him, a bottle in her hand. He runs toward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil! Dil! What the fuck are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you to stay in the hotel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you was fooling me. Thought you was leaving me. They are tussling in the darkness of the park. She is ver drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to go to work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stayed all day in that room thinking every noise was you. There's something you're not telling me, Jimmy. He takes her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm going home... Fergus and Dil, on the stairs up to Dil's flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to get out of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Tell me everything, Jimmy. Fergus looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to forget you ever saw me, Dil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And she suddenly faints into his arms. As if on cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, would you? There is no response. He shakes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it over, Dil, for fuck's sake -- Still no response. He grows alarmed. He slaps her cheek. opens her eyes slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I get nervous. I got this blood condition. Just help me inside, Jimmy, then I'll be all right. INT. DIL'S FLAT - NIGHT. He walks in holding her. Leans her against the wall, then goes to the window to check the street outside. She takes a large slug from a bottle of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard what I said, Dil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pills... She points weakly to a cabinet through the open door of t bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prescription. For my condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What condition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My condition. Ennui. He goes and gets the pills. She takes a handful of pills. She drinks from the whiskey bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you supposed to take that many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in times of extreme stress. She walks around the room, drinking, then sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, they all say good-bye sometime. 'Cept for him. She looks at the picture of Jody. Then she looks at Fergu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Dil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be. She stares straight ahead, the bottle clutched in her han between her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, then. Fergus walks slowly toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Dil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go like that. She looks at him, standing up. Something incredibly attractive about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help what I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks slowly toward her. He kisses her, on the lips. We see the photograph with the soldier's smiling face. Fe looks from it to her. She seems to be in a sweet narcotic haze. She reaches out her hand and strokes his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knew you had a heart... Fergus sits down on the bed. Dil is lying back on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil Can I tell you something? I knew your man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew which man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew my Jody? She still strokes his hand. Her voice is dreamily slurred her eyes far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifted him from a carnival in Belfast. Held him hostage for three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew my Jody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listening? Dil smiles woozily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the order to shoot him. Before I could do it he ran. Ran into a tank and died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Died...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed my Jody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a manner of speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you... She is not rational. She is smiling, far away somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should scream. You should beat my head off. She woozily tries to hit him round the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed my Jody

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to kill me? Dil raises an unsteady hand and points it at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang... He strokes her cheek. She says very slowly and sleepily

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me tonight. Might kill me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Her eyes close. She falls into a deep sleep. Fergus looks down at her, almost fondly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are lying on the bed together, fully clothed. Dil wa She rises very quietly and goes to his coat, thrown acros chair. She searches through the pockets and takes out the gun. INT. HOTEL ROOM - MORNING. Jude in bed. An alarm sounds; she reaches to turn it off. INT. DIL'S FLAT. Dil takes several silk stockings out of a drawer and ties them very securely to each corner of the brass bed. She t them round both of Fergus's feet, very gently, so as not wake him. INT. HOTEL ROOM - MORNING. Jude, in front of a mirror, getting ready. INT. DIL'S FLAT. She draws one of Fergus's hands up, very gingerly, and ti that securely to the upright. She ties the other and is drawing it upward when he wakes. She jerks the silk stock so it is secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck -- Dil speaks unnaturally quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me what you're doing, Jimmy. INT. HOTEL ROOM - MORNING. Jude, fully dressed. She takes a gun from under the bed a slips it in her handbag. INT. DIL'S FLAT - MORNING. Dil crouching beside Fergus, his gun in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't really listen last night. I heard but I didn't listen. Fergus, staring at her. He tries to pull on the bindings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't do you no good. Dil knows how to tie a body. She stands up, still pointing the gun at Fergus. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wondered why you came on to me like that when you gave me the look. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to see were you all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude on the street. Maguire's car pulls up rapidly and sh gets inside. INT. DIL'S FLAT. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I fix on anyone that's nice to me. Just the littlest bit nice and I'm yours. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Dil -- DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't kick Dil and she'll be touched. Be nice to her and she'll be yours forever. She looks at him, tears in her eyes. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I should blow you away, Jimmy. But I can't do that. Yet. FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go, Dil He drags at his bindings. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to be somewhere. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try and go, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure of the judge in the window. Outline of a woman Jude and Maguire are in the car, parked across the street They look toward a paper seller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is he? Christ -- INT. DIL'S FLAT. Fergus pulls furiously at his bindings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go for fuck's sake, Dil -- or they'll be here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them come then. IN THE CAR. OUTSIDE BROTHEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't stay here, Peter -- drive around once more -- He drives off. INT. DIL'S FLAT. Fergus collapsed back on the bed, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just want your company for a little while longer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maguire's car driving round once more. No sign of Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fucker's dead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we are. INT. DIL'S FLAT. Fergus strains and roars from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're doing, Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never did... MAGUIRE'S POINT OF VIEW -- the brothel door opening. The elderly judge comes out. The car with his security men gu up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the shooter, Jude --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the fucking shooter! He grabs it from her pocket. Throws open the door and run across the street. Jude dives into the driver's seat. INT. DIL'S FLAT. Fergus, pulling at his bindings. EXT. OUTSIDE THE BROTHEL. The judge walking toward the open door of the car, held o by his goon. Maguire, running toward him, gun in hand. Th goon sees him. Maguire shoots as he runs. Once, twice, th times, four. The judge falls. The goon, hit in the arm, p an Uzi and returns fire. Maguire hit, still shooting. Oth goons tear from the car. Mayhem, screaming. Jude hits the pedal on her car and screeches off. Maguire, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil dressed in the soldier's cricket clothes. She looks l a sweet little boy. She places a cassette in the tape dec "The Crying Game" song. She comes to the bed, and points gun at Fergus's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like me now, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a bit more, baby, a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More endearments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, DIl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Dil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you, Dil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything. She begins to cry and lays the gun gently on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd do anything for you, Dil. She pulls on his bindings to release him. EXT. STREET. Two police cars, sirens wailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil's face, close to Fergus's, as the stockings that boun his hands are nearly undone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll never leave me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're lying, Jimmy, but it's nice to hear it. His arm is free. He strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Dil. She shudders with weeping. The music of the song plays in background. Jude walking through the open door, arms extended, holdin gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid shit -- Once was bad enough. But twice. Dil rises from the bed and points her gun at Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't knock, honey -- Dil fires, hits Jude. Jude falls and is writhing on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that thing off me, Fergus -- Dil walks closer, holding the gun and pointing it at Jude

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that she called you, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Fergus? FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my name, Dil -- DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Jimmy? JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said get it off me, Fergus -- Jude, on the floor, reaches for her gun. Manages to grab DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she going to do, Jimmy? She going to blow you away? Dil shoots again, like a child, playing with a toy. She h Jude in her gun shoulder. Jude spins one way, the gun the other. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she there too? When you got my Jody? Fergus screams FERGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dil!!! DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you a question, honey -- were you there too -- JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick bitch -- As she raises the gun, Dil shoots her repeatedly, saying: DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You was there, wasn't you? You used those tits and that ass to get him, didn't you? Fergus screams from the bed. He rips free his other arm. shoots Jude in the throat, and she falls dead, covered in blood. Dil turns the gun on Fergus. DIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was there, wasn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she used her tits and that cute little ass to get him, didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what she wore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't remember... Dil points the gun at him, squeezing on the trigger. Then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do it, Jimmy. He won't let me. She looks at the picture; walks over and sits down in fro of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't let me, Jody -- She raises the gun and places it in her mouth. Fergus tak it gently from her mouth and places it on the table. He l her up by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to go now, Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I in trouble, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will, Dil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I to go, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Metro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet Col --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Say hello to Col -- He leads her out the door. Fergus goes back into the room past Jude's body. Looks out the window to where he can se Dil staggering down the street, through the crowds that h gathered. The wail of police sirens coming closer. He wat Dil run off, with her funny walk. Then looks down and see the cop cars pushing through the knot of people around th house. He picks up the gun, wipes it with a rag to remove Dil's fingerprints. He turns to the picture of the soldie talks to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have stayed at home. He sits in the chair by the window, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP to reveal a large interior, with light streaming the windows. Large barred doors open and a group of women come through, with parcels, children in tow, etc. Among t is Dil, looking resplendent. She walks past the rows of convicts with their families, up to a glass cage, where Fergus sits, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you the multivitamins and the iron tablets, hon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, love. Now, the white ones are magnesium supplement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to keep you healthy, Jimmy. I'm counting the days. Two thousand three hundred and thirty-four left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, darling. I keep forgetting the leap year. What am I supposed to call you then, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fergus. Fergus my love, light of my life -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Dil --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help it. You're doing time for me. No greater love, as the man says. Wish you'd tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the man said, it's in my nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there was this scorpion, you see. And he wants to go across the river. But he can't swim. So he goes to this frog, who can swim, and he says to him, "Excuse me, Mr. Froggy..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK, and as Fergus tells the story of the scorpion and the frog, the music comes up -- "Stand By Yo Man."
